title: New Pre-Defined Scenarios Available
text:
Three new pre-defined scenarios were recently added to the Scenario Analysis tab. One covers the 2013 Taper Tantrum, when investors were worried the Fed was moving to raise rates too soon. Another covers the market downturn that occured in the fourth quarter of 2018, and the third considers the European Debt Crisis that happened in 2011 as a carryover event from the Greek debt crisis in 2010. These scenarios were added based on feedback from users, so be sure to visit the Ideas page to submit your own suggestions to Morningstar about how to improve the appliccation.

Note the three scenarios selected here.

Remember that you can always read the details of a scenario by using the Component Settings icon to change the Data View to a Table, then hover the cursor over the Information icon.

Viewing the scenarios in a table allows users to see a description of each one.
